text: [2013] 200ml bottle. Copper pour with a few bubbles laying on top. Flavors are funk, wood, apples, maple syrup, brown sugar, alcohol and spices with light acidity. Medium to full body, slick texture.
Amber-brown. Legs. Good acidity,bright apple, golden-brown sugars. Very drinkable, just a touch of spice.

Tasting at Matts, corked bottle; vintage 2011; 11% ABVAmber color, bright. The aroma focuses on the stewed pears, the flavor is rich, plenty of stewed fruits, some raisins too, a lot of Demerara sugar, moderate acidity for an Ice Cider, the final has some more feeling of white sugar.Rich sipper, moderately complex.

375mL bottle, sent from yourilevesque (thanks a lot, Youri), pours a clear caramel brown. Nose is very rich, with loads of treacle toffee, caramel apple, and brown sugar. Flavour is intense and incredibly smooth, with loads of treacle toffee, some vanilla, caramel apple, and brown sugar. Amazingly smooth and integrated, with tons of layers. Elegant, deep, rich and complex. Fantastic.
Bottle - Sweet cooked red apple. Clear Amber. Rich and sweet cooked Apple with a touch of peel bitterness. Very thick and syrup like.

Cant remember where I got this bottle. Drank half of it 6 months ago and forgot it in the back of the fridge. Looks like reddish cane syrup very thick. Big alcohol legs. Smells like baked Apple with fried pear, brown sugar and Christmas. Intense sweetness. This really is cloyingly sweet. Almost beyond what I can handle. That baked apple flavor is persist at.

200ml bottle, 2009 vintage, 12%. Clear orange amber colour with no head. Nose of fruity apple, apple pie, caramel, brown sugar, melon, spice. Flavour is mellow apple, sweet, toffee, sugar, caramel, vanilla, summer fruits, plus some spice and tartness. Syrupy mouthfeel, full bodied, low carbonation, clean dry finish with a little residual sweetness. Nicely balanced, very drinkable.

Bottle shared, 2011 vintage. Deep copper brown pour, very light haze. Aroma is very nice, rich mellow apple notes, vanilla, light caramel, quite spicy, tons of cinnamon. Taste is where its at though, such beautiful rich layers of different sugars, brown sugar, maple, vanilla, cinnamon, butter, caramel, with a nice fruity acidity to just gently balance things a bit. Palate is rich, full bodied, liquory. One of the best.
Sample thanks to kraddel. 11%. Pours orange. Aroma is sweet, apple. Taste is medium sweet, apple. Thick mouthfeel.

Thanks to Kraddel. 2011 Vintage. Small sample. Deep amber, candied apples. Nose is thick caramelized apple, huge sugar, cinnamon & pie, very straightforward in the best way. Taste is candied apples, apple orgy, thick sugar, caramel, cinnamon, no noticeable heat. Very thick. Very straightforward ice cider. Fantastic.

2011 vintage @ 11 ABV . Pours rather dark blonde . 
Smell is applejuice, sweet and thick as it should be . Taste is thcik, sweet, applesauce , very damn nice once again bit sharp , some boozy aspect . 
We have a winner !
Bottle shared by Ryan or James. Pours golden brown with no head or lace. Apple skins, caramel, and wood were the flavors on this girl. Straight apple juice for the dads out there.

Bottle... This ice cider rocks! Clear deep amber with hundreds of short, thin legs. The bouquet is an excellent, complex fusion of freshly sliced McIntosh, Granny Smith and Red Delicious apples. There is an ethanol component is a tad overbearing, but not all that offensive. Full-bodied with a velvety mouthfeel and no carbonation. The flavor is hearty and sweet, then quickly morphs to a sharply tart, raspy, dry finish. Muchos kudos to Marheb for providing this gem!
bottle shared by Big Daddy Redmond at his Thursday clink & drink - dark and sweet ice cider. caramelized apple and pie spice, with some tart fruits. brown sugar finish with warm booze.
Bottle at DadsThursday. Pours orange amber. Nose and taste of frozen apple, brown sugar, sugared apple and light apple acidity. Smooth. Full bodied.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 Bottle shared with max, clockwork, Andy, pearl, Zdk and Paul. Pours a deep caramel body with no head or lacing. Aroma is super rich, musky fruit. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of dusty oak barrels, apple pie, musky fruits and light acidity. Awesome. Revisit July 2016. Bottle courtesy of Paul. 2010-2011 vintage iirc. Deep ruby red body. Nose is absolutely beautiful - thick and luscious with maple, vanilla, sugars and apple juice. Lovely gentle fruit skin acidity on the backend. +0.2

Drank to celebrate Jesss PhD defense!  200 ml bottle.  Pours still, orange, and clear.  Aroma of sweet apples and some booziness.  Taste brings much more complexity.  Caramel apple sweetness with a nice balance of acidity.  Upon some sips, I got a hit of cheese in there. Full mouthfeel with a much more acidic and dry finish.  The aroma didnt necessarily bode well for this one, but Im glad the flavor really came out.  Really delicious stuff and would certainly try again some time.

Bottle (200 ml). Golden amber. Strong apple aroma, more than in most of the Ice cider Ive tasted so far. A lot of sweetness here along with slight fruity notes. Taste is heavily sweet with apple, fruits and slight spices. Warming alcohol/sugar. Medium body. Another very good Ice cider!

Medium amber with lighter gold edges, 2009 bottle.  Sweet apple, honey, light caramel with some acidity in the front and finish. More pear like, more tropical fruits than LA Face, with a lighter feel and some pleasant spices. Finish has a lighter oxidized note. Just realized this is Avalanche and not the normal Los saragnant cider, which explains the pear flavors.

[4950-20121116] 341mL bottle. Light apple skins aroma. Clear, amber orange body with thick legs. Tasty apple skins sweetness in the flavour. Medium body. Very sweet but finishes crisply with a nice aftertaste. (8/4/8/4/17) 4.1
(Vintage 2008; w/ jercraigs, JoeMcPhee, Radek Kliber)

2012-11-16. Dark amber body, headless, syrupy silky legs on the glass. 3+ Smells great, sweet concentrated baked apples, tart apples follow. 8+ Rich flavour, sweet fruity apple base, muted sugary accents, modest acidity balances it very well. 8+ Smooth syrupy full body is still. 4+ Lovely stuff.  Bottle, 2008 Vintage from Marche au Saveurs, Montreal

Bottle 200 ml  , 2008 Vintage 10%  
Aroma:   tart , red apple , alcohol with apple finish. True apple character. Solid ! 8- 
Look:  fine haze , amber look , rocky top. Presentable , good appearance. 3+
Taste/palate:    full bodied, rich , caramelized apple feel with alcohol that is well incorporated in structure. Cinnamon sweet sugars noted second. Very good.

Bottle courtesy of jercraigs and mabel. The nose is incredible. Bright acidity and some fresh apple character with a bit of baked apple. Intensely sweet and rich with a lot of cooked apple character. Lingering acidity and very delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

La version vendue à la SAQ.  Une belle robe dorée bien limpide.  De belles jambes qui saccrochent à la paroi du verre.  Un nez chargé par les pommes et par dautres fruits du verger.  Des notes de petits fruits rouges.  Du miel sauvage et des notes de sirop dérable.  Au goût, des notes collantes de pommes qui sont traversées par une chaleur et par une certaine acidité.  En bouche, une agréable sensation.  Un corps rond qui se laisse facilement apprivoiser.  En finale, une ode sucrée fortement complexe avec un mouvement acidulé et un moment réconfortant.
Cider of the night.  Pours an orange amber syrup.  Aroma is cooked apples, honey sweetness and apricot.  Taste is syrupy texture, honey and apricot with a cloying sweetness.  Great cider.

2008 vintage. 200ml bottle shared between 2 personas... Pours a predominantly copper mildly amber hue with absolutely no head whatosoever which is to be expected with a nice glazed over film of legs running down the sides of the glass... Sweet sacharine honey and liquor soaked rum apples. Very dessert like in essence with almost a thick honey like texture. Solid but the sweetness was a touch overbearing... Flavors are sweet and syrupy with concentrated caramelized  granny smith apples. Sweet up front through the middle and continues on through the finish. Medium to full consistency with a pretty full bodied experience. Not much more to say except that its  a solid ice cider thats well deserving of a try.  Wish there were more of it to go around for this tasty little treat.

Bottle, thanks kan! Pours clear deep reddish gold no head. Nose of sweet candied granny smith, pleasant but real sweet and straight forward. Flavors are real sweet green apple peel, honey, wow real crisp and super clean. Long sweet finish that never becomes too much.

200 ml bottle, dipped with red wax and corked. Pours a clear yellow almost reddish with some bubbles and a bit of legs on the glass. A sweet sugary nose of apricot and massive apples, very ripe. The flavor exhibits some sourness, some heat, mostly sticky sweet overripe apples, but the sweetness does border on apricot as well. Very nice and different.

Sample, Mondial des cidres de glace, savoured on February 12 2011; eye: golden; nose: apple, strawberry, light honey, dry fig; mouth: apple, strawberry, light honey, dry fig, finale in apple with presence of strawberry, medium body, rather sweet, light acidity; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS 

Échantillon, Mondial des cidres de glace, savourée le 12 février 2011; 
il : dorée; nez : pomme, fraise, léger miel, figue séchée; bouche : pomme, fraise, léger miel, figue séchée, finale en pomme avec présence de fraise, corps moyen, plutôt sucré, légère acidité; en résumé : bien

The 2008 vintage, pouring at Le Mondial des Cidres Glaces.  Pours a clear golden treacle color. Cool apple, light acid.  Borders or being super sweet, but the slowly developing acid holds it loosely in check.  Acid, toast, and warm caramel on the finish.

A cognac like cider with aroma of cooked apples, maple and strawberries, very nice. In mouth, a clean caramel apple taste with burned sugar, maple, alcohol warmth lingering. My favorite at Mondial des cidres de glace, Feb. 12 2011.
